meanings.definition: Consisting of a single legislative chamber.
meanings.sent1: The state has a unicameral legislature, which means all decisions are made in one room.
meanings.sent2: The unicameral system allows for quicker decision-making processes.
meanings.sent3: In the unicameral assembly, everyone has to sit close together like a big family.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style is unicameral, always making decisions swiftly and independently.
meanings.sent5: The unicameral structure of the government is like a single beam of light illuminating the path forward.

meanings.definition: Relating to a legislative body with only one chamber.
meanings.sent1: The unicameral parliament meets in the same room for all discussions.
meanings.sent2: In a unicameral system, there is no need for separate chambers for different functions.
meanings.sent3: The unicameral council had to get creative with seating arrangements to fit everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her decision-making process is unicameral, always consulting with herself before finalizing choices.
meanings.sent5: The unicameral nature of the organization streamlines communication and decision-making.
